intro: Chamaesyce villosior, commonly known as the hairy chamaesyce, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are characterized by their soft, hairy texture and lobed shape, while its flowers are small and clustered in a structure called a cyathium. Chamaesyce villosior is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
